item.title: Colophon
item.description:
Purpose

Saunter is my personal link log‚ÄîPinboard bookmarks flow into Micro.blog via the microintegrations middleware. This page collects the credits and moving pieces so future me (or another builder) knows what powers the site.

Platform & Hosting

  • Engine: Hugo compiled by Micro.blog. Each deploy renders the Saunter theme bundled in this repo.
  • Hosting: Micro.blog serves the static site and handles media uploads.
  • Automation: GitHub Actions in microintegrations run the Pinboard ‚Üí Micro.blog sync every hour and commit state updates.

Theme & Front-end

  • Theme: Custom Saunter theme (Fraunces for headings, Inter for body text, color palette inspired by the Wonky Editorial prototype).
  • Components:
    • Timeline cards render full post content with category badges.
    • The /seattle/ live cam pulls a fresh waterfront frame on each page load.
    • Light/dark toggle respects local time, OS preference, and manual overrides stored in localStorage.
  • Assets: Fonts from Google Fonts; icons are inline SVGs in the templates.

Newsletter & Forms

  • Provider: Mailchimp audience f901f7d258. The footer form posts directly to the Mailchimp endpoint with a honeypot field for bots.
  • Search roadmap: /search/ will embed Micro.blog‚Äôs user-scoped search results so readers stay on the site while searching the archives.

Middleware

  • Repository: github.com/rocksoup/microintegrations
  • Scripts: scripts/microblog-sync.mjs orchestrates Pinboard RSS ‚Üí Micropub posts. State lives in .microblog-state.json and is trimmed to 500 entries on save.
  • Env Vars: PINBOARD_MICROBLOG_FEED_URL, MICROBLOG_TOKEN, DRY_RUN.

Credits & Thanks

  • Micro.blog for the platform and Micropub API.
  • Pinboard for the simple RSS feed powering the integration.
  • The Seattle waterfront cam for giving /seattle/ a live skyline view.
  • Everyone filing issues in this repo‚Äîyour notes shape the roadmap.

If you notice something broken or want to borrow ideas, open an issue or ping me on Micro.blog (@jfunk).

item.title: Winning more matches with the same game üéæ
item.description:
Lately my biggest insight on the tennis court has been about how to find ways to do more with what I have(something I imagine will be more important as I get older), and I have been surprised at the positive results I have seen.

The two big ideas I have been focusing on both have to do with an awareness of what is happening on the other side of the net.

item.title: Courageous Actions
item.description: Tonight I tried to order a drink at a recommended local restaurant and was told “that must be a Salt Lake thing, I am from Chicago and have never heard of a negroni”. It took everything in me to overcome the awkwardness of my decision to stand up and walk out of there, but I was strong and found a spot that new exactly what a negroni is. ü•É
Some people think Fremont is the center of the universe and some other people think this place is
